Instructions.text: Press the round button about the MINE stream box to go to the Feed view. The stream entering the tank is called FEED. It has a certain grade of valuable metal, in our case copper.
Look at the graph. What is the copper grade of this mine?
As a flotation operator you want to make sure you are producing the right amount of concentrate according to your feed flow rate.
You can check that by finding the CONCENTRATION RATIO. It represents the amount of tons you need to feed the cell in order to produce one ton of concentrate.
For example, if your concentrate flow rate is 2 t/h with a feed flow rate of 10 t/h, your concentration ratio is 5. The cell is producing one ton of concentrate with 5 tons of feed.

Let's put this knowledge into practice. What is the concentration ratio of this flotation cell with recovery above 80%?

 Concentration ratio =
Feed flow rate / Concentrate flow rate

Good job! Now press the circle in the mine icon and change the Feed flow rate to something like 15. Did the concentration ratio changed? 

 Concentration ratio =
Feed flow rate / Concentrate flow rate
Exactly! Cells are usually designed to work with a specific Concentration Ratio. In next lessons we will learn about other performance calculations
